paragraph.heading:
Coelogyne punctulata Lindl., Coll. Bot .
: t. 33, 1824

subSubSection.paragraph:
Heterotypic synonyms:
Coelogyne ocellata Lindl.
,
Gen . Sp. Orchid. Pl
.: 40, 1830.

Coelogyne punctulata var. hysterantha Tang & F.T.Wang, Acta Phytotax. Sin.
1: 78, 1951.

Specimens examined:—
KACHIN . Putao District :
1220–1525 m
,
31 Jul 1937
,
Kingdon-Ward 12860
( BM )
;
same loc.,
1220 m
,
30 Nov 1953
,
Kingdon-Ward 21637
( BM )
;
same loc.,
1830−2590 m
,
28 Dec 1961
,
Keenan et al. 3079
( E )
;
same loc.,
1830−2135 m
,
Jan 1962
,
Keenan et al. 3208
( A , E , K , RAF )
;
same loc.,
Dec 2015
,
Saw Lwin KSL 1029, 1051, 1057, 1071 & 1086
( RAF )
;
Myitkyina District : fide
Aung et al. (2020: 72)
.
MANDALAY . Pyinoolwin District :
120 m
,
Jul 1935
,
Bogg s.n.
in
Maymyo Bot. Gard. 13513
( K )
.
Distribution:— The Himalayas, northeastern India , Myanmar and southwestern China .

Note:— Keenan et al. 3208 is a small-flowered form of this species that also occurs in China , which has been confused with
C. nitida (Wall. ex D.Don) Lindl.

Coelogyne putaoensis
X.H.Jin, L.A.Ye & Schuit., PhytoKeys
82: 28, 2017. Type :— MYANMAR . Kachin State : Putao District ,
2500–3100 m
,
14 Jun 2016
, Jin et al. PT-2116 ( holotype : PE)

Specimen examined:—
KACHIN . Putao District : type . Distribution:— Endemic
.

Coelogyne rigida C.S.P.Parish & Rchb.
f., Trans. Linn. Soc. London 30: 146, 1874. Type :— MYANMAR . Mon State : Mawlamyine District ,
Parish 42
( holotype : W-R; isotype: K)

Homotypic synonym:
Pleione rigida
(C.S.P.Parish & Rchb.f.) Kuntze,
Revis. Gen . Pl.
2: 680, 1891.

Specimens examined:—
KACHIN . Putao District :
2 May 1953
,
Kingdon-Ward 20763
( BM , K ); same loc.,
1220 m
,
11 May 1953
,
Kingdon-Ward 20650
( BM , K ); same loc.,
1830−2135 m
,
16 Jun 1953
,
Kingdon-Ward 20986
( BM , K ); same loc.,
26 Feb 2007
,
Kurzweil & Saw Lwin KL 2290
( SING )
.
MON . Mawlamyine District : type
.
TANINTHARYI . Dawei District : fide
Aung et al. (2020: 72)
.
Distribution:— The eastern Himalayas, northeastern India , Myanmar , Thailand , Vietnam and southwestern China .

Coelogyne sanderae Kraenzl.
,
Reichenbachia
, ser. 2, 2: t. 56, 1893. Type :— MYANMAR . Upper part: imp.
Sander s.n.
( lectotype K, designated by Seidenfaden 1992: 117)

Heterotypic synonym:
Coelogyne sanderae O’Brien, Gard. Chron .
, ser. 3, 13: 360, 1893, in fig. 52 on p. 361 as
C. sanderiana
[non Rchb. f. 1887].
Type :— Not designated
.

Specimens examined:— UPPER MYANMAR . Type ; same loc., cult. Birmingham Bot. Gard. s.n. (K). KACHIN . Putao District: fide
Aung et al. (2020: 72)
. CHIN . Mindat District: Swinhoe 32 (K). SHAN . Taunggyi District: fide Nyan Tun (2014: 133 ; as
Coelogyne sp.
). BORDER AREA KAYAH – KAYIN (Bawlake – Hpa-An). 1920 m , Oct 1939 , Dickason 9469 (AMES). WITHOUT LOCALITY. Cult. Glasnevin Bot. Gard. s.n. (K). Reported from Sagaing , Magway and Mandalay regions by
Kress et al. (2003: 70)
, but we have not seen material from these areas.
Distribution:— Myanmar , Vietnam and southwestern China .

Note:— It is not really certain if O’Brien intended to describe
C. sanderae
; the following week in the Gardeners’ Chronicle (ser. 3, 13: 391) it was explained that the relevant part of
Reichenbachia
had not reached the editor of Gardeners’ Chronicle in time, and the name could therefore not be credited to Kraenzlin.

Coelogyne schilleriana Rchb.
f., Berliner Allg. Gartenzeitung 26: 189, 1858. Type :— MYANMAR . Mon State : Mawlamyine District , 1857, cult.
Schiller s.n.
( holotype : W)

Heterotypic synonym:
Pleione schilleriana J.Dix, Proc. Roy. Hort. Soc. London
4: 137, 1864.

Specimens examined:—
MON . Mawlamyine District : type ; same loc.,
Parish 40
( K )
.
TANINTHARYI . Dawei District :?
Apr 1901
,
Mokim 593
( K )
;
same loc.,
Rule 5398
( K )
.
WITHOUT LOCALITY.
Cult. Mamyo Bot. Gard.
ex
Swinhoe 25
( K )
;
cult.
Calcutta Bot. Gard. s.n.
( GH )
.
Distribution:— Myanmar and Thailand .

Note:— In the description of
P. schilleriana
(attributed to J.Dix, the chair of the meeting where it was presented), a basionym is not given, and it is therefore considered a new species, not a transfer.
